intro: Erigeron brachycephalus, commonly known as the short-headed fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and roadsides. It produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers, blooming in the summer months. Erigeron brachycephalus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
